qas.question: Name three approaches software testers take when testing their software?
What is the term that is used to described executing programmed code with a given set of test?
What are commonly used techniques during dynamic testing?

answers.text: stubs/drivers or execution from a debugger environment

qas.question: There are few approached in what type of testing?
Examples of static testing include previews, walkthroughs, and what other item?

plausible_answers.text: a given set of test cases

qas.question: Dynamic testing refers to executing predetermined code with what?

plausible_answers.text: when the program itself is run

qas.question: When does dynamic testing not take place?

context: There are many approaches available in <b4_0>software<b4_0/> testing. <a0_0>Reviews, walkthroughs, or <b5_0>inspections<b5_0/><a0_0/> are referred to as static testing, whereas actually executing programmed code with <b6_0>a given set of test cases<b6_0/> is referred to as <a1_0>dynamic testing<a1_0/>. Static testing is often <b8_0>implicit<b8_0/>, as proofreading, plus when programming tools/text editors check source code structure or compilers (pre-compilers) check syntax and data flow as static program analysis. Dynamic testing takes place <b7_0>when the program itself is run<b7_0/>. Dynamic testing may begin <a2_0>before the program is 100% complete<a2_0/> in order to test particular sections of code and are applied to discrete functions or modules. Typical techniques for this are either using <a3_0>stubs/drivers or execution from a debugger environment<a3_0/>.
